technical_features.source_sentence: The optimized device exhibits a luminance exceeding 1,600,000 cd m⁻² at the bias of 6.5 V.
The CE reaches a maximum value of 204.2 cd A⁻¹.
The TE QLED fabricated using the index-lowering process shows a T95 of 15,600 h at 1000 cd m⁻².
Our TE QLED achieves an EQE value of 29.2%, which is a 1.81-fold enhancement compared to the BE counterpart.
An angular color shift of Δu’v’ = 0.0052 from 0° to 60° is achieved by narrowing the emission linewidth of quantum dots.
These QDs exhibit [...] an internal PLQE of 90.3% in solid films.
The measured spectrum centers at 537 nm with a full width at half maximum (FWHM) narrowed from 21.5 to 19.2 nm.

qualitative_insights.main_objective: Develop high-performance top-emitting quantum-dot light-emitting diodes (QLEDs) with enhanced brightness, efficiency, stability, and minimal angular color shift through structural and optical optimizations
key_methodology_summary: Refractive-index-lowering process creating nanogaps between QDs
Single-mode optical microcavity design with corrected penetration depth calculations
Dual IZO phase tuning layer implementation
primary_findings_conclusions: Current efficiency of 204.2 cd/A and EQE of 29.2% without light extraction
Operational lifetime T90=15,600 hours at 1000 nits
future_work_suggested_by_authors: Integration of microlens arrays/scattering layers for light extraction
novelty_significance_claim: First demonstration of single-mode green QLED with electrical-optical synergy
Resolution of penetration depth calculation controversy in microcavity design
Record performance metrics across luminance/efficiency/lifetime triad

Figure 2: L-J-V characteristics and lifetime data
